text: Age-related decreases in <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> production by human T cells are associated with impaired activation of nuclear transcriptional factors AP-1 and NF-AT .

Although transcriptional factors AP-1 and nuclear factor of activated T cells ( NF-AT ) are important for the normal induction of <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , it is unknown if the age-related decline in <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> production by activated human T cells may be associated with aberrancies in transcriptional regulatory proteins .

In the current studies , <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> production by T cells from elderly ( mean 78 years ) and young ( mean 37 years ) humans was measured in cultures stimulated with <extra_id_0> PHA <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> PHA <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> plus PMA , crosslinked anti-CD3 mAB OKT3 plus PMA , or PMA plus ionomycin .

Substantial decreases of <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> production were observed for cell cultures from 7 of 12 elderly individuals in response to the different stimuli , whereas the levels of <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> produced by stimulated T cells from other elderly individuals were equivalent to those observed for stimulated T cells of young subjects .

Analyses of nuclear extracts by electrophoretic DNA mobility shift assays showed that decreased <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> production by stimulated T cells of elderly individuals was closely associated with impairments in the activation of both AP-1 and NF-AT .
By contrast , T cells from elderly subjects with normal levels of <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> production exhibited normal activation of AP-1 and NF-AT .

In addition , the results of competition experiments analyzing the normal components of NF-AT showed that the age-related reductions in stimulus - dependent NF-AT complexes corresponded to the slow migrating complexes that were composed of <extra_id_0> c-Fos <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> / <extra_id_0> c-Jun <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> AP-1 .

The resting and stimulated levels of NF kappa B were reduced in T cells from certain elderly individuals ; however , alterations of NF kappa B did not correlate with changes in <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression .

Thus , these results show that age-related impairments in the activation of AP-1 and NF-AT are closely associated with decreased expression of <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and further suggest that aberrancies in the signaling pathways important for the induction of transcriptionally active <extra_id_0> c-Fos <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> / <extra_id_0> c-Jun <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> AP-1 may contribute to the impaired activation of NF-AT .
